intro: Vieusseuxia gracilis, commonly known as the slender glassworts, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline habitats. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or white, and it reproduces through seeds. Vieusseuxia gracilis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms in its ecosystem.
